page.title: 03Police Station, Whitfield
page.content: The police station is situated on the Sandwich road opposite the new houses and was built in June 1952. There used to be 20 policemen but now there is just one village policeman to cover the whole of the village. The present constable has worked here for 4 years and thoroughly enjoys his job and in his spare time plays football, cricket and rugby. He has 3 children who attend the local schools. Most crime in the village is committed by strangers who break the speed limit on the A256. The longest crime free period was 18 months.
